4.heading: Padawans.
4.title: Rite of Passage
4.author: script, John Ostrander ; pencils, Jan Duursema ; inks, Ray Kryssing ; colors, Brad Anderson ; letters, Digital Chameleon ; cover artist, Jan Duursema & Dave McCaig.
notes: 1 v. : col. ill. ; 26 cm.
(Star Wars)
"This volume collects issues #42-45 of the Star Wars comic-book series."

Summary (from SkyRiver): A royal heir has been kidnapped-along with Jedi Master Tholme, who was protecting the boy. Now two of Tholme's former Padawans have teamed up to rescue their master, unaware of the forces arrayed against them. Their most immediate foes are a father and son team of Morgukai assassins, who have the training and the weapons to go toe-to-toe with Jedi. But behind it all are the machinations of the notorious Count Dooku!

(Star Wars Knights of the Old Republic ; v. 5)
(Star Wars Dark Times ; v. 3)

Summary (from SkyRiver): Celeste Morne encounters an ancient Sith artifact, an army of Mandalorians, and Zayne Carrick, the Padawan accused of killing his fellow students.

92.heading: Padma Purana.
92.title: "Nahusha : He Became the King of Heaven"
92.author: script, Gayatri Madan Dutt ; illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; editor, Anant Pai
92.appears_in: p. 1-31 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 695 (1984, 2009 printing).
notes: (Epics & Mythology)

Summary from back cover: "Even though Nahusha, the son of King Ayus and Queen Indumati, was spirited away at birth to be killed by the demon, Hunda, he lived on to achieve immortality. Married to Ashokasundari, the beautiful daughter of Shiva and Parvati, he was elected to be the king of heaven. And then his mortal mind succumbed to the sin of pride. The stories of Nahusha are taken from the Padma Purana and the Mahabharata."

95.heading: Padmavati.
95.title: Anathe : based on a popular Kannada novel
95.author: by Prof
95.appears_in: Gopalakrishna Adiga ; script, Kodibettu Rajalaxmi ; English version, Sowmya Devaraj ; art, Gujjarappa.
notes: Bangalore, India : Indya Comics, between 2000 and 2012?
(Illustrated Kannada Classic Novels ; no. 6)

"Anathe is the story built round Padmavati, a woman in distress. After her husband flees the village to escape law as he had failed to repay the loans he had raised, a pregnant Padmavati is forced to quit the house. She walks out and lands at bachelor Seenappa's house in pouring rain. Seenapa considers his duty to help her out but the village community takes offence. It is not proper for a bachelor, living alone, to offer shelter to a woman in his house, even if she is in dire need of help, is the community's argument citing tradition in support of their stand. But Seenappa defies the dicta of the community and stands by her. He tries to locate her husband who, in the meanwhile, gets set to marry another girl thinking that Padmavati might have died. Will they unite? What situation whill she face? Prof. Gopalakrishna Adiga weaves a story which is set in coastal Karnataka in the early '50s."

96.title: Padmavati, Queen, consort of Ratana Simha I, Rana of Chitor, fl. 1303. "Padmini : a Tale of Love and Honour"
96.author: script, Yagya Sharma ; illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; editor, Anant Pai
96.appears_in: p. 1-32 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 605 (1973, 2009 printing).
notes: (Bravehearts)
Begins: "Chittor is the soul of Rajasthan. Its history is the saga of Rajput valour."

Summary from back cover: "Hers was a face that made powerful monarchs lose their wits. having seen Padmini's reflection in a mirror, Sultan Ala-ud-din Khilji wanted her more than anything else in the world. But she was already the queen of brave Ratnasen, ruler of Chittor. In an unfolding drama of lust and treachery, Ratnasen's band of Rajput warriors displayed the outstanding courage for which they were rightly famous. And Padmini showed the world what love and honour mean to a woman."

143.heading: Padrón, Juan, 1947- --Interviews.

143.author: Manuel Pérez Alfaro
143.appears_in: p. 131-136 in La Revista Latinoamericana de Estudios sobre la Historieta, v. 1, no. 2 (Junio 2001).
notes: Interview.
Padrón was born in 1947.

Resumen: "Juan Padrón Blanco es el autor más popular en Cuba en el campo del cine de animación y la historieta, con una temprana carrera en ambos que alcanzó su climax con el personaje Elpidio Valdés. Actualmente reúne una considerable filmografia, entre ellos, varios largometrajes, además de sus numerosos aportes al humorismo gráfico."

Abstract: Juan Padrén Blanco is the most popular author in Cuba in the animation and comics fields, with a long career in both which achieved its climax with his character Elipdio Valdés. Presently his filmography is considerable including several feature films in addition to many graphic humor contributions.
Abstracts as printed with the article, with some editing of the English.
Includes illustrations.
